result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriella D. Herpin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Court calls 16CM38, 16CM78 & 17CF84 @ 02:09 PM Defendant Gabriella D. Herpin in court with attorney Alec Nocco.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives plea agreement, 17CF84 Ct 1 DRI, Ct 2 plea, Ct's 3 4 & 5 DRI, 16CM78 Ct 2 & 16CM38 Ct 1 Stipulate that DEJ revoked, withheld sentence 1 year probation, costs DNA Surcharge and Sample, AODA and follow through with treatment recommendation,  Absolute sobriety, Maintain employment & counseling deemed by agent.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charge and penalties. 17CF84 Ct 2 Poss of THC, no contest plea. Court will grant State motion to DRI Ct's1, 3, 4 & 5. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. Def. understands elements.  Atty Nocco is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Ct 2 Poss of THC. State gives sentence recommendation. 17CF84 2 days credit, 16CM78 2 days credit.  Atty Nocco gives sentence recommendation. Def. makes statement. Court finds DEJ is revoked on 16CM38 & 16CM78. Court orders  same sentence on each ct's  withheld sentence 1 year probation, costs, 200 DNA Surcharge on each count and DNA Sample, AODA and follow through with treatment recommendation,  Maintain Absolute sobriety, Maintain full time employment/ 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for  & counseling deemed by agent.  16CM78 & 17CF84 2 days credit on each case if revoked.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement

Defendant Gabriella D. Herpin in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CM38 & 16CM78  @  10:13 am. State gives plea agreement, Plea to Ct 2 in 16CM78, Ct 1 in 16CM38, Remaining DRI, Defer Judgment for 1 year with conditions in agreement.  Atty Kohn and defendant agree with plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charge and penalties.  16CM38 Ct 1 Poss of THC, Guilty  16CM78 Ct 2 Criminal Damage to Property, Guilty & DRI 16CM38 Ct 2, & 16CM78 Ct's 1 & 3.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understand elements.  Atty Kohn is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Stipulate to factual basis on both complaints.  Court finds factual basis, accept pleas, and finds def. Guilty to Poss of THC in 16CM38 and Criminal Damage to property in 16CM78 directs clerk to delay entry of sentence and will approve order. Restitution to be determined, May request hearing. Court will order 2 days credit if sentenced.  Review hearing scheduled for August 31, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Gabriella D. Herpin in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.   State presents argument for bond.  Bond set by court.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Court directes clerk to enter not guitly pleas.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
